text.__SUMMARY__:
Allium teretifolium is a plant species native to Xinjiang, Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan.Allium teretifolium produces clusters of narrow bulbs, each about 10 mm in diameter. Scapes are up to 50 cm long, round in cross-section. Leaves are tubular, about 1 mm wide, shorter than the scape. Flowers are pink or violet.
